articles.author: Zahra, Product manager, PMS team
articles.description:
Improvement
  
Good news! After releasing the new calendar interface, many of you reacted, we thank you for that, and we heard your feedbacks ! 
We did some evolutions to adapt the calendar new interface and make it match your needs. 
What are the main evolutions?
1- More listings displayed
In the first version of new calendar interface the planning was limited to 25 properties, now it goes up to 100 properties.
2- The filters
Few hours after the release we enabled all the 8 filters !
3- The logos more visible
The logos of the sources are now colored in white, it makes them more visible 
Small tip💡
Some of you need to visualize more properties on the planning view.
If you zoom out your calendar page you can make the lines thinner and be able to see more properties.

We invite you to discover all these evolutions, and hope it will help you to have a better management of your calendar, save more time, and make more bookings !
Wishing you all a pleasant day!
articles.title: Evolution - New Calendar Interface

articles.description:
Oct 24, 10:27 PDT
Resolved - This incident has been resolved. The increase in 500 errors occurred between 4:00 a.m. and 7:00 a.m. PDT. Please reach out to us via the Support Portal if you are still experiencing 500 errors.

Investigating - We are having a site wide issue causing 500 errors across all APIs. We are currently investigating, and we will post updates as we have more information.
articles.title: 500 Error Across All APIs

articles.description:
Oct 21, 16:03 PDT
Resolved - We have identified an issue with creating room amenity photos. The issue would cause POST requests to fail with either a 404 error or a 500 error. This issue approximately started from last Friday, October 14th, 2022. The photo creations are successful in most cases but the requests fail at a later stage resulting in error responses.
We have fixed this issue at 3:30pm PT today, but there can be duplicate photos created for room amenities during this time. We advise you to review room amenity photos and use the DELETE endpoint to remove duplicate photos.
We are sorry for the inconvenience.
articles.title: Requests to create room amenity photos failing (Listing Photos POST Request)

While the incident was active, you may have noticed an increase in 500 errors across all our endpoints. Hosts and guests might have been unable to access listings through the Airbnb website. We apologize for the inconvenience. Don't hesitate to contact us via the Support Portal if you need additional information.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-10-29 07:00 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Nov 3, 2022, 1:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change. The affected users are able to access Google Calendar, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.

Due to time zone changes in Mexico taking effect from 2022-10-30 (Chihuahua specifically), your Google Calendar may:

  • Show the wrong time with the red bar on Calendar Web;
  • Have the wrong times for single events, recurring events, or appointments
  • Affect RSVP responses for recurring events**

Google engineers are working on a mitigation which is expected to complete by Wednesday, 2022-11-02 17:00 US/Pacific.

Mitigation

  • If single events appear at the wrong time, manually move the events to the right time.
  • If recurring events appear at the wrong time, you can make nearly any modification to the series, like adding a space to the summary, and it should fix the events that appear at the wrong time after the transition.

Important: Making a modification will also reset any event in the series that had specific changes so that it matches the original event. Some examples of one-off changes that will reset include single events that:

  • were moved to a different time
  • included other attendees
  • had a different summary

Attendees of recurring events may also see that events they accepted are no longer accepted or that events they declined are no longer declined.

If recurring events appear at the wrong time for some guests, any update to the original event should fix the series for the owner and all of the guests.

Affected products: Google Calendar
articles.title: UPDATE: We're aware of a problem with Google Calendar affecting a significant subset of users. We will provide an update by Nov 3, 2022, 12:00 AM UTC detailing when we expect to resolve the problem. Please note that this resolution time is an estimate and may change. The affected users are able to access Google Calendar, but are seeing error messages, high latency, and/or other unexpected behavior.

articles.description:
Incident began at 2022-10-28 16:22 (times are in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC)).

We expect to resolve the problem affecting a significant subset of users of Google Meet at Nov 4, 2022, 8:00 PM UTC. Please note that this time frame is an estimate and may change.

We will provide more information by Wednesday, 2022-11-02 7:00 PM UTC on progress of the mitigation.

Customer Symptoms: Some users of Meet iOS app may be unable to complete Phone Number registration and as a result can not use calling features.

The affected users should still be able to join Meet sessions

No workaround at this time.

Affected products: Google Meet

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 28, 2022 from about 1:06 PM PDT to 1:17 PM PDT, some customers experienced trouble loading threads, sending messages, and saving bookmarks.


This issue occurred when we deployed a web app change resulting in an increased database load. We have since rolled back the deploy, restoring functionality for all affected users.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues sending messages, loading threads, and saving bookmarks

articles.description: We've resolved the issue involving emoji codes not appearing properly when an emoji is sent as a standalone message. If you're still encountering any trouble, please reload Slack using Command + Shift + R (Mac) or Ctrl + Shift + R (Windows/Linux). Thank you for your patience while we sorted out this issue.
articles.title: Incident: For an emoji sent as a standalone message, the emoji code is not displayed on hover

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 19, 2022, from 8:17 AM to 10:13 PM PDT, some users saw a "Something went wrong" error when attempting a search query.


This issue was caused by a recent code change that resulted in searches failing. 


We reverted this change, which fixed the issue for all users after a reload of Slack.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are having issues searching in Slack, seeing the "Something went wrong" message.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 13, 2022 from 3:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. PDT, a number of customers had trouble loading and receiving thread notifications. Some customers may have also had trouble with loading channels, adding users to group direct messages, API hyperlink rendering, and missing Saved items.


A mass de-provisioning event inadvertently increased load across our infrastructure, causing issues with Threads for many users. 


As an immediate mitigation strategy, we temporarily deactivated the Threads view for all users. 


In parallel, we ended the long running de-provisioning jobs, and significantly scaled up the systems that handle those jobs. We also made several code changes to reduce the effect a de-provisioning job of this scale would have on our infrastructure, and redistributed some of the load across other parts of the system. 


The optimisation and redistribution work brought error rates down, which resolved most of the issues with channel loading, group direct messages, hyperlinks, and Saved items that users were experiencing. 


At this point, we made the call not to re-enable the Threads view in order to give our recovery efforts more time to restore balance to the system. 


Once the load was appropriately balanced across our infrastructure, and we were able to confirm that our up-scaling systems were prepared to handle any future spikes, we re-enabled the Threads view for all users.
articles.title: Incident: Some users are experiencing issues loading Slack, including the Threads view, Saved items, notifications, API hyperlinks, and group DMs/channels

articles.description:
Issue summary:


Starting around 12:00 AM PDT until 08:30 AM PDT on October 12, 2022, some users experienced issues with connectivity and threads loading.


We discovered that an unusually large number of requests within a short timeframe resulted in a database failure causing errors and slowness.  The issue has since been resolved.


Please contact feedback@slack.com for a Root Cause Analysis if one is required for your team.
articles.title: Incident: Some users may be experiencing issues with loading Slack.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

On October 10, 2022 from 5:04 PM PDT to 11:01 PM PDT, some users experienced issues when switching channels in Slack. This resulted in saved items, threads, mentions and reactions, (as opened on the right-hand side) being hidden immediately.


We identified that the issue was the result of a recent update. We have rolled back this change which has fixed the issue for all impacted users.
articles.title: Incident: When switching channels, items that open on the right-hand side including threads, mentions & reactions, and saved items hide immediately.

articles.description:
Issue summary:

From 12:46 PDT on October 3, 2022 until 7:42 PDT on October 6, 2022, customers on the Free and Pro plans using a confirmation code to log in, saw an invalid code error when entering the code they received by email.


The issue was traced to a recent update. Reverting this update fixed the issue for all affected customer.
articles.title: Incident: Issues with login confirmation codes

Scheduled - Please note there is scheduled infrastructure maintenance on Wednesday 26th of October, between 5 AM and 6 AM CEST, when you can expect few short service interruptions. During this maintenance following services will be affected:
- Migrations will not be available
- Shared hooks created within maintenance will not be accepted nor processed
- Logins to platform might be affected
- Registration of new subscribers won't be possible
- Invitations of new team members won't be possible
- E-mails and notifications might be delayed
- Password reset won't be possible
- Payments for subscription plans won't be accepted  
We will inform you once the maintenance is completed.

Reauthorization of your Facebook connection is not needed. Oct  5, 22:54 CEST
Investigating - Facebook and Instagram apps
Facebook has temporarily revoked our Facebook OAuth app. Therefore, Facebook and Instagram connections in Integromat and Make have expired.
We are working on a fix ASAP. You might need to reauthorize your Facebook connection then.
Affected apps: Facebook, Facebook Ads Campaign Management, Facebook Catalogs, Facebook Conversions API, Facebook Custom Audiences, Facebook Groups, Facebook Insights, Facebook Lead Ads, Facebook Offline Conversions, Facebook Pages, Instagram for Business.

articles.title: Scheduled infrastructure maintenance

articles.description:
Oct  3, 10:07 CEST
Resolved - This incident has been fully resolved.
Sep 29, 11:41 CEST
Update - Due to the DDoS attack, Make servers were unable to receive some webhook requests from our customers and as a result, such data couldn't be delivered to scenarios. In some instances data was redelivered at a later point, but in order to be sure, we advise that you reload any data from the app-list below that was uploaded during the following time frames (times shown in CET):
26.9.2022 18:00 - 27.9.2022 15:20
27.9.2022 19:20 - 27.9.2022 23:50
Our investigation revealed webhooks coming from those apps were affected:
Slack, Zoom, Facebook Lead Ads, Intercom, Segment, Todoist, Quickbooks, Square, Instagram, and Box
Sep 28, 15:22 CEST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and the service is now st…
articles.title: DDoS attack mitigated
